{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3492322,"name":"Esther","username":"Macieira_63","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/c5a1d2/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-25T15:03:15.051Z","cooked":"

Lately our team has started using Pigeon 2.0 and after defining the position of the electrical components, we tried to calibrate Pigeon 2.0 but we have been facing problems.
We can’t leave Yaw at zero no matter how much we try to calibrate it the way the documentation indicates, out robot
is aligned with the wall so that we can train in the living room area, but in the computational graph it returns me 56 degrees even if I press the “Begin mount Calibration” button. Can anyone help me with this?

IMG_09663024×4032 2.63 MB
